meanings.definition: (rare) A measuring instrument, especially one whose name ends in '-meter'.
meanings.english_definition: (rare) A measuring instrument, especially one whose name ends in '-meter'.

examples.sentence: A barometer is a type of trometer used to measure atmospheric pressure.
examples.translation: バロメーターは大気圧を測定するために使用されるトロメーターの一種です。

etymology.value: A humorous or nonce word formed by analogy with existing measuring instrument names ending in "-meter".

usage_notes.explanation: This word is rarely used in formal contexts. It is usually employed humorously or informally to refer to any measuring device, especially if the speaker doesn't know the specific name of the instrument.

readability_explanation.text: The word 'Trometer' is not a standard English word and is very rarely used. It is more of a playful or humorous term used to refer to any measuring instrument, especially when the specific name is unknown or unimportant. Because of its rarity, it is not part of standard language learning curricula.
